element.label: IEN
element.definition: This is the prescription number.

element.label: PATIENT
element.definition: The patient receiving treatment.

element.label: PROVIDER
element.definition: Doctor who wrote the prescription.

element.label: QTY
element.definition: This field is used to show the amount of medication that was dispensed.

element.label: DAYS SUPPLY
element.definition: Enter a whole number between 1 and 90.  The maximum upper limit is 90, but may be lower based on the maximum specified for this patient status. This parameter is defined in the RX PATIENT STATUS file.

element.label: # OF REFILLS
element.definition: The number of refills allowed per prescription.

element.label: PROVIDER COMMENTS
element.definition: This field stores any provider comments that are passed to Pharmacy from CPRS.

element.label: ENTERED BY
element.definition: This field will show who requested the rx.

element.label: ISSUE DATE
element.definition: Date when doctor wrote prescription.

element.label: LOGIN DATE
element.definition: The date the prescription was entered.

element.label: COSIGNING PHYSICIAN
element.definition: This field identifies the cosigning physician for prescriptions written by a provider for whom a counter signature is required, for example a nurse practitioner.

element.label: LAST DISPENSED DATE
element.definition: This field contains the last fill date.

element.label: SERVICE CONNECTED
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the medication being prescribed is for a service connected condition. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

element.label: DOSAGE ORDERED
element.definition: This is a single dose of medication the patient will receive for this Rx order.

element.label: DISPENSE UNITS PER DOSE
element.definition: This is the number of Units (tablets, capsules, etc.) to be dispensed as a dose for this order.

element.label: UNITS
element.definition: Unit of measure.  Pointer to the Drug Units file (50.607).

element.label: DURATION
element.definition: This is the length of time that a medication order should be given. If you enter a numeric value, Days will be assumed. You may also enter a numeric value followed by a letter. The letters can be entered as 'M' for Minutes, 'H' for Hours, 'D' for Days, 'W' for Weeks, 'L' for Months.   THIS IS NOT DAYS SUPPLY!

element.label: CONJUNCTION
element.definition: This code is used to help build a Possible Sig for a complex medication dose.  This code usually expands to an "and", a "then", or an "except".

element.label: ROUTE
element.definition: This is how the medication is taken, applied, or used.

element.label: SCHEDULE
element.definition: This field is used to tell the patient how often the medication is to be used.

element.label: VERB
element.definition: This verb will be used to describe how the medication will be taken/used.

element.label: OTHER LANGUAGE DOSAGE
element.definition: This is a single dose of medication the patient will receive for this Rx order.  Data should be entered into the field when the patient has another language preference and there is a free-text of a local dosage entered.

element.label: DISCONTINUE TYPE
element.definition: This field is used to distinguish what type of external discontinue action occurred.

element.label: PHARMACY ORDERABLE ITEM
element.definition: This is the Pharmacy Orderable Item associated with the drug. This data should not be entered by using File Manager.  If the Rx does not have a Pharmacy Orderable Item entered check the drug for the RX.  If the drug is missing an orderable item match the drug not the Rx.  Only matching the Rx will cause problems when renewing the Rx.

element.label: SIG1
element.definition: This holds a Sig from OERR.

element.label: STATUS
element.definition: This field represents the current status of the prescription.

element.label: TITRATION DOSE RX
element.definition: This is the Titration Dose Rx from which the corresponding  Maintenance Dose Rx originated.

element.label: MAINTENANCE DOSE RX
element.definition: This is the Maintenance Dose Rx that was created from the corresponding  Titration Dose Rx.

element.label: TITRATION RX FLAG
element.definition: This flag indicates whether the prescription is being dispensed as a  Titration Dose. It is intended to identify a Titration Dose Rx without  a corresponding Maintenance Dose Rx.

element.label: MILITARY SEXUAL TRAUMA
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been treated for Military Sexual Trauma, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition related to Military Sexual Trauma. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

element.label: AGENT ORANGE EXPOSURE
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to Agent Orange during Vietnam service, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

element.label: IONIZING RADIATION EXPOSURE
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to ionizing radiation during military service, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

element.label: SOUTHWEST ASIA CONDITIONS
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to Southwest Asia Conditions (formerly referred to as Environmental Contaminants), the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

element.label: HEAD AND/OR NECK CANCER
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been treated for Head and/or Neck Cancer due to nose or throat radium treatments while in the military, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat this condition. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

element.label: COMBAT VETERAN
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the  medication being prescribed is for a condition related to Combat Services  while in the military. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription.

element.label: PROJ 112/SHAD
element.definition: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the medication being prescribed is for a condition related to PROJ 112/SHAD while in the military. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription.

element.label: STATUS
element.definition: This field represents the current status of the prescription.
